articles.author: Nathan Layne, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump said he will hold a news conference on Thursday afternoon at his residence in Palm Beach, Florida, his first public appearance since his Democratic opponent, Kamala Harris, selected Minnesota Governor Tim Walz as her running mate.
articles.title: Trump to hold news conference while Harris visits Michigan auto workers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Microsoft researchers said on Friday that Iran government-tied hackers tried breaking into the account of a "high ranking official" on the U.S. presidential campaign in June, weeks after breaching the account of a county-level U.S. official.
articles.title: Microsoft researchers report Iran hackers targeting US officials before election

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russian forces were battling Ukrainian troops for a third day on Thursday after they smashed through the Russian border in the Kursk region, an audacious attack on the world's biggest nuclear power that has forced Moscow to call in reserves.
articles.title: Russia battles Ukrainian troops for a third day after major incursion

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina will return to her country when its new caretaker government decides to hold elections, her son said, but it was not clear if she would contest.
articles.title: Sheikh Hasina will return to Bangladesh for elections, her son says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro on Thursday said he has signed a resolution to block access to social media platform X in the country for 10 days.
articles.title: Venezuela's Maduro signs decree blocking X access for 10 days

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Leaders of Qatar, Egypt and the U.S. on Thursday invited Israel and Hamas to resume Gaza ceasefire talks on Aug. 15 to close all remaining gaps in a proposed agreement and start implementing it without further delay.
articles.title: Qatari, Egyptian, US leaders invite Israel and Hamas to resume talks on Aug. 15

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Alexandra Ulmer, Nathan Layne
articles.description: A little over two weeks ago, Donald Trump's presidential campaign had visions of an expansive national strategy that would result in a landslide victory in November.
articles.title: How the Harris surge scrambled Trump's battle plan

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um, Devjyot Ghoshal
articles.description: Thailand's Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin will likely survive a critical court decision next week that could see him dismissed from office, beating back military-appointed former lawmakers who had targeted the premier, his chief of staff said.
articles.title: Dismissal case against Thai PM likely to fail, says chief of staff

articles.author: Michael Kahn
articles.description: As instructors shout commands, dozens of students taking part in a pilot Czech army programme aimed at boosting flagging enlistment numbers crawl through forest scrub carrying combat rifles and learning proper shooting positions.
articles.title: Eastern Europe's armies struggle to enlist young people with war not far away

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Extreme rainfall and severe flooding in China led to a near doubling in economic losses from natural disasters in July from a year earlier, the government said.
articles.title: China's rains and floods led to near doubling of natural disaster losses in July
